tools.python.convert_index_to_time¶

tools.python.convert_index_to_time(idx: int, time: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, t_start: float = 0, t_end: float = 200, dt: float = 2) → float¶

Return ‘real’ time for a given index

Parameters

  • idx (int) – Index to convert

  • time (np.ndarray, optional) – Time data; if not provided, will be assumed from t_start, t_end and dt variables, default=None

  • t_start (float, optional) – Start time for overall data, default=0

  • t_end (float, optional) – End time for overall data, default=200

  • dt (float, optional) – Interval between time points, default=2

Returns

time – The time value that corresponds to the given index

Return type

float

tools.python.check_list_depth
